title: Are people with a mental health condition told about possible medication side effects?
analysis_commentary:
It is important that people are told about possible medication side effects so that they can make an informed choice about whether the medication is right for them. It also guides them on what to expect from a medication to reduce panic or worry should a side effect occur.

Although data before 2008 is not directly comparable to 2010 onwards, the proportion of respondents who weren't told about possible side effects from their new medication has been decreasing since 2004. In 2013, only 28% felt they weren't told about possible side effects compared to 35% in 2004. This is a decrease of 7%.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
